intro: Disporopsis taiwanensis, commonly known as the Taiwan disporum, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically features grass-like leaves and produces small, white or greenish flowers during the spring season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions with rich, humus-filled soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
